original: Anderberg, Karin Ingeborg, läroverksadjunkt, Åmål, f. 21/5/99 i Sthlm av förste kontr. i järnv:styr. Gust. E. Eriksson o. Hilma Andersson. G. 37 m. lärov:adj. Kristian Anderberg. — Stud:ex. i Sthim 25, stud., v. Upps. univ. 25, fil. mag. 31. Lär. v. Nya elem:sk. f. fl i Sthlm 29-30, v. adj. i Sollefteå 32, v. ämneslär. i Västervik 33, timl. i Katarina realsk. o. Nya elem:sk. f. fl. i Sthlm 33-35, e. lär. i Bromma 35-36, i Malmö 36, e. adj. v. Malmö realsk. 38, e. o. adj. där 38-40, i Kristianstad 40-41, v. Malmö realsk. 41, adj. i modersm. o. tyska v. Åmåls samrealsk. sed. 46. Föret, resor t. Tyskl. 23, Österr. 31, Tyskl. o. Österr. 33, Österr. 34, Tyskl. o. Österr. 36, Tyskl. o. Frankr. 38.
translated: Anderberg, Karin Ingeborg was a gymnasium adjunct from Åmål. She was born on May 21, 1899 in Stockholm to Gust. E. Eriksson, a first contractor in railroad control, and Hilma Andersson. She married gymnasium adjunct Kristian Anderberg in 1937. Anderberg obtained her high school diploma in Stockholm in 1925 and studied at Uppsala University in 1925. She received her Bachelor of Arts degree in 1931. She taught at various schools in Stockholm including Nya elem:sk. from 1929 to 1930, Sollefteå as an assistant from 1932, Västervik as a subject teacher from 1933, Katarina realsk. o. Nya elem:sk. from 1933-1935, Bromma as a junior teacher from 1935-1936, Malmö as a junior teacher in 1936. She became an assistant in Malmö realsk. in 1938, and then became a full-time assistant from 1938-1940. She worked as an adjunct in German and mother tongue at Åmåls samrealsk. since 1946. She has traveled extensively to Germany in 1923, Austria in 1931 and 1934, Germany, and Austria in 1933, Austria in 1934, and Germany and France in 1938.

employmentHistory.name: Åmåls samrealsk.
employmentHistory.jobTitle: Adjunct in German and Mother Tongue
